intro: Didymoglossum reptans var. schaffneri, commonly known as the Schaffner's moss, is a rare and delicate species of liverwort belonging to the family Pterygopariaceae. It is characterized by its small, closely arranged leaves that are typically green or reddish in color, depending on environmental conditions. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rocky or forested areas with high humidity. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short, erect stalks and release spores when mature. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
